intro: Boronia inornata, commonly known as the slender boronia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is found in coastal and inland regions of southern Australia. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or white, and it blooms during the spring and summer seasons. Boronia inornata is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained conditions.
